title: Interactive game concept brainstorm
description:
As a game designer, I want to interactively brainstorm and refine a game concept with the agent so that I have a solid foundation (core loop, aesthetics, mechanics) before simulating gameplay.

Acceptance Criteria:
- /game:brainstorm starts with an open-ended prompt asking the user to describe their game idea freely
- Agent extracts structure (genre, core loop, aesthetics, platform, mechanics) from the user's natural description
- Agent only asks follow-up questions for things genuinely unclear or missing — no rigid questionnaire
- Produces concept.yaml with structured concept data (genre, core_loop one-sentence, aesthetics, platform, input_method)
- Produces brainstorm.md with narrative exploration of the concept
- Seeds decisions.log with brainstorm-phase decisions, each tagged with origin (user/suggested/inferred)
- References game-spice skills: game-mechanics-palette, game-scoping, game-design-frameworks
- Validates concept is a digital/video game (not board game, card game, tabletop RPG)
- Chains to /game:simulate when user is ready

Tracer: /game:brainstorm → user describes idea → agent extracts + probes gaps → verify concept.yaml + brainstorm.md + decisions.log with provenance → chain to simulate

title: Create /game:brainstorm command
description:
Concept pipeline — proves conversational extraction produces structured output.

Create commands/brainstorm.md with:
- Frontmatter: description, argument-hint, allowed-tools (Read, Write, Glob, Grep, AskUserQuestion, Skill)
- Step 1: Load session state (read .game-design/<session>/state.yaml)
- Step 2: Open-ended prompt — ask user to describe their game idea freely (NOT a genre/aesthetic/platform questionnaire)
- Step 3: Extract structure from response — identify genre, core loop, aesthetics, platform, mechanics from what the user naturally said
- Step 4: Probe gaps only — ask follow-up questions ONLY for things genuinely missing or ambiguous (e.g. input method not mentioned)
- Step 5: Core loop validation — reference game-scoping for one-sentence test, validate with core loop checklist
- Step 6: Reference game-mechanics-palette and game-design-frameworks to enrich/validate (not to interrogate)
- Step 7: Digital game validation — confirm it is a digital video game
- Step 8: Write outputs — concept.yaml, brainstorm.md, seed decisions.log with provenance (user/suggested/inferred per decision)
- Step 9: Update state.yaml (brainstorm: complete)
- Step 10: Handoff — AskUserQuestion: continue to /game:simulate, review, or done

CRITICAL DESIGN RULES:
- Conversational extraction, NOT step-by-step questionnaire
- If user says 'a roguelike where you grapple through dark caverns' — genre, feel, visual style are already implied, do NOT ask them to classify these
- Every decision tagged with origin: user (they said it), suggested (agent proposed, they accepted), inferred (agent extracted from context)
- If too many consecutive decisions are suggested/inferred, pause and prompt user to drive

Deliverable: commands/brainstorm.md

title: Interactive ASCII gameplay simulation
description:
As a game designer, I want to simulate gameplay moments with ASCII wireframes and narrative descriptions so that I can experience, test, and refine my game design before writing any code.

Acceptance Criteria:
- /game:simulate presents an ASCII wireframe + narrative text describing a gameplay moment
- Each turn asks the user questions about how the game should behave via AskUserQuestion
- User responses are recorded as decisions in decisions.log with category, rationale, and alternatives
- Each turn is saved as a standalone file in simulation/turns/turn-NNN.md
- ASCII wireframes are saved separately in simulation/wireframes/wf-NNN-description.txt
- Coverage tracker (coverage.yaml) tracks 5-Beat areas: uncovered/partial/covered
- Agent prioritizes presenting moments from uncovered areas, then partial areas
- Simulated game state (game-state.yaml) tracks player position, abilities, world state
- After 15+ turns or all beats covered, agent suggests transitioning to /game:build-plan
- Session can be interrupted and resumed — state persists between conversations

Tracer: Load concept → present Beat 1 wireframe → user responds → record turn + decision + coverage → present Beat 2 → verify multi-turn

title: Create /game:simulate command — core loop
description:
Simulation engine — proves the interactive loop works end-to-end.

Create commands/simulate.md with:
- Frontmatter: description, argument-hint, allowed-tools
- State loading: read state.yaml, concept.yaml, coverage.yaml, game-state.yaml, legend.yaml, last 3 turns
- Skill references: ascii-wireframing for starter patterns, simulation-guide for facilitation, game-scenario-walkthrough for beat structure
- Turn presentation: choose next beat/area based on coverage → generate ASCII wireframe + narrative → present with questions via AskUserQuestion
- Response handling: record user decisions to decisions.log with provenance (origin field: user/suggested/inferred) → update coverage.yaml → update game-state.yaml → write turn file + wireframe file
- Decision provenance: tag each decision with origin — "user" if explicitly stated, "suggested" if agent proposed and user accepted, "inferred" if extracted from context without explicit confirmation
- Rubber-stamp guard: if too many consecutive decisions are "suggested", pause and prompt user to drive ("I've been filling in blanks — what do YOU think should happen here?")
- Resurface inferred decisions: when revisiting an area with "inferred" decisions, explicitly ask user to confirm or revise them
- ASCII legend management: maintain legend.yaml — propose new symbols when new game elements appear, let user override conventions, include legend in each wireframe for self-contained readability
- Multi-turn: after each turn, ask Continue simulating? or suggest transition if coverage is sufficient
- Scope control: reference simulation-guide for diminishing returns detection
- State persistence: update state.yaml with turn count and coverage after each turn

Deliverable: commands/simulate.md
